metadata.title: CVE-2023-47359 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Videolan VLC prior to version 3.0.20 contains an incorrect offset read thatleads to a Heap-Based Buffer Overflow in function GetPacket() and resultsin a memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47359` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
libvlccore8 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-data - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-nox - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-samba - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vlc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm3').
